NaivePyDESSEM

Main modules (DESSEM/DECOMP/MDI):

  • DESSEM/DECOMP/MDI
NaivePyDESSEM
  • NaivePyDESSEM and NaivePyDECOMP documentation
  • View page source

NaivePyDESSEM and NaivePyDECOMP documentationïƒ

Official documentation of the NaivePyDESSEM, NaivePyDECOMP and MDI projects, two pedagogical and modular economic dispatch/ explansion panning solvers based on Pyomo.

NaivePyDESSEM - A pedagogical and modular economic dispatch solver based on Pyomo (DESSEM + DECOMP + MDI like solvers).ïƒ

NaivePyDESSEM is a pedagogical project that brings together two complementary packages for teaching and research in power system operation planning:

  • NaivePyDESSEM â€” inspired by DESSEM, it models the short-term (daily/hourly) operation with detailed individual plant representation.

  • NaivePyDECOMP â€” inspired by DECOMP, it models the medium-term (weekly/monthly) operation with deterministic dual dynamic programming (PDDD).

  • MDI â€” Generation Expansion Planning inspired by MDI methodology.

Both are implemented in Pyomo, with modular architecture and integrated documentation via Sphinx.

ğŸ” Overviewïƒ

This project replicates key concepts of the DESSEM, DECOMP and MDI methodologies, covering hybrid economic dispatch problems involving thermal, hydro, renewable, and storage units.

The goal is to provide a clean teaching tool for courses such as EELT 7030 â€” Operation and Expansion Planning of Electric Power Systems.

ğŸ” Featuresïƒ

  • NaivePyDESSEM:

    • Detailed short-term hydrothermal dispatch (hourly/daily).

    • Individual representation of hydro and thermal units (MILP/MIQP).

    • Includes ramping limits, startup/shutdown, minimum up/down time, etc.

  • NaivePyDECOMP:

    • Aggregated medium-term hydrothermal dispatch (weekly/monthly).

    • Simplified thermal representation (Gmin, Gmax, Cost).

    • Hydros aggregated into REEs with constant productivity.

    • Supports single LP or Deterministic Dual Dynamic Programming (PDDD).

  • MDI:

    • Generation Expansion Planning using Mixed Integer Linear Programing (MILP)

    • Simplified Generation Representation

  • Shared features:

    • Modular equation/constraint builders.

    • CLI tools for solving and exporting results.

    • LaTeX export and plotting utilities.

    • YAML-driven model configuration.

The goal is to provide a clean teaching tool for courses such as EELT 7030 â€” Operation and Expansion Planning of Electric Power Systems

ğŸ›  Dependenciesïƒ

The following Python packages are required to run NaivePyDESSEM:

Package

Version Requirement

PyPI Link

colorama

>=0.4.6

colorama

matplotlib

>=3.10.5

>=2.3.2

pyomo

ğŸ›  Installationïƒ

pip install naivepydessem

Or from source:

git clone https://github.com/superflanker/NaivePyDESSEM.git
cd NaivePyDESSEM
pip install -e .

Similarly, using git ssh clone url:

git clone git@github.com:superflanker/NaivePyDESSEM.git
cd NaivePyDESSEM
pip install -e .

â–¶ï¸ Usageïƒ

Solving a modelïƒ

DESSEM-like dispatch (short-term)

pydessem-solve path/to/case.yaml --out_dir results/ --out_file dispatch.csv

DECOMP-like dispatch (medium-term)

Single-LP:

pydecomp-solve path/to/case.yaml --out_dir results/ --out_file dispatch.csv

Using PDDD:

pydecomp-pddsolve path/to/case.yaml --out_dir results/ --out_file dispatch.csv

MDI Like Generation Expansion Planning

mdi-solve path/to/case.yaml --out_dir results/ --out_file dispatch.csv

Plotting resultsïƒ

pydessem-plot results/dispatch.csv --mode plot --category G V --plot-style line

pydecomp-plot results/dispatch.csv --mode plot --category G V --plot-style line

mdi-plot results/dispatch.csv --mode plot --category G --plot-style line

ğŸ“„ Referencesïƒ

This implementation is based on academic material from UFPR (Federal University of ParanÃ¡) and CEPEL/DESSEM/MDI manuals:

  • Unsihuay Vila, C. IntroduÃ§Ã£o aos Sistemas de Energia ElÃ©trica, Lecture Notes, EELT7030/UFPR, 2023.

ğŸ“š How to Citeïƒ

If you use NaivePyDessem in teaching or research, please cite:

@misc{adams2025pydessem,
